name: HTB Certified Defensive Security Analyst (CDSA)
description: This was my first real dive into the security world, and it was brutal. I survived on minimal sleep during that 7-day exam marathon, but I pushed through and delivered two commercial-grade reports to pass. It taught me as much about mental endurance as it did about defensive security

name: Junior Penetration Tester (eJPT)
description: I took this as a warm-up for the OSCP. To make it interesting, I treated it like the OSCP by self-imposing OSCP rules: no AI help and a strict 24-hour limit. I’m happy to say I cleared it within that window, which gave me a some confidence boost for my upcoming exams.

name: Certified in Cybersecurity (CC)
description: Since this one was free, I figured why not. I just booked a slot, walked into the testing center, and knocked it out. It’s a solid way to validate the IT fundamentals I’ve picked up over the years.

name: Cisco CyberOps Associate (CCOA)
description: I picked this one up while working on my Master’s. Since it was already part of my course syllabus, it served as a great deep-dive revision into networking.
